body_html:
To be honest, I have reservations about changing this. When you call torch.log on something with zeros, you are buying NaNs.
Imagine you changed this. Next you'll have that b = a - 1; c = torch.log(b + 1)[b > -1] behaves differently from torch.log(a)[a > 0] (or does it even work with +0, too?).

Basically, the "complete fix" would be to have 0 * NaN = 0 in grads, but IMHO that is bogus arithmetics.
